Bolstered Arms of Revolution Called for
articles.content:
Bolstered Arms of Revolution Called for  
   Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- An appeal adopted at the meeting of frontrunners of the Songun revolution calls on all the servicepersons and people to strengthen the arms of the revolution, not getting relaxed with the possession of a powerful nuclear deterrent, saying there is not the slightest vacillation in the will of the Workers' Party of Korea to bolster the national defence capacity, no matter how the situation may change. 
 With the shouts of hurrah over the victory of the Songun revolution ringing louder, it is all the more necessary to firmly maintain the revolutionary and class principles and heighten revolutionary vigilance whereby to resolutely foil the moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK on the part of the enemies including the U.S. imperialists and the Japanese reactionaries and their psychological campaign and capitalist ideological and cultural poisoning for disorganizing it from within and firmly defend the characteristics of Korean-style socialism, the appeal stresses.

Paektusan Cup Int'l Figure-skating Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
Paektusan Cup Int'l Figure-skating Festival to Be Held 
   Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The 16th Paektusan Cup International Figure-skating Festival will be held in Pyongyang from Feb. 15 to 17 on the occasion of the February holiday.
 The festival will bring together ace skaters from different countries and excellent players of the DPRK.    
 It is to be held in the form of exhibition performances in ice dance, pair, single and other events.

Photo Session for Frontrunners of Songun Revolution
articles.content:
Photo Session for Frontrunners of Songun Revolution
   Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The participants in the meeting of frontrunners of the Songun revolution had a photo session at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the sacred temple of Juche, on Tuesday.
 Among those present were senior party, army and state officials.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Grenada
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Grenada
   Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Keith Mitchell, Prime Minister of Grenada, on the occasion of the 33rd anniversary of its independence.
 Believing that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop favorably, the message wished the prime minister and the people of Grenada fresh success in their work for prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Russian Musician Arrives
articles.content:
Russian Musician Arrives
   Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Leonid Nikolayev, professor and chief conductor of the Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory in Russia, and his party arrived here Tuesday to celebrate the birthday of Kim Jong Il.
